page.title: 05Horses in Knockholt
page.content: Many people in Knockholt own their own horses and ponies, which are mainly used for their own pleasure. A lot of children go to the local Pony Club events, the nearest is at Sevenoaks. There are two local riding stables, one has horses at livery. The Mountross Shetland Pony Stud was started in 1969 by Mrs Brenda Holly whose Shetland Ponies are the smallest breed in the British Isles being only 28 to 38 inches in height. Though they are the smallest breed of ponies they are very hardy and live out all year even in the hardest conditions. Many of Mrs Holly's foals are exported to the United States of America, Holland and Germany to be used for showing and breeding.
